comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: She is carrying peonies.  So it must be May.  He looks much older that she does.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Call it May-December, then. ;-) This is Ethel, his second wife. Much younger, yet he outlived her. John Brisben Walker was the owner and editor of Cosmopolitan magazine for fifteen years, before he sold it to William Randolph Hearst in 1905. He also was an early investor in the automobile industry, and owned the Locomobile company, and had production rights in the Stanley Steamer. More: www.co.jefferson.co.us/jeffco/openspace_uploads/mount_fal...
